intro: Hippochaete debilis, commonly known as the slender broom. It is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its delicate, branched stems and small, yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its showy inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in open grasslands or disturbed areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercialized.
